subject: Baseball
lead_paragraph: After the ugly breakup with catcher Michael Barrett and the ugly American League production of his replacement, Jason Kendall, the call-up of Geovany Soto, below, must have been music to the ears of Cubs fans. Soto hit .353 with 26 homers in Class AAA this year and was the reason the team was confident enough to trade the talented Barrett. Unfortunately for those fans, the Cubs are still managed by Lou Piniella, who has a hard time trusting young players.
